{"step_by_step_thinking": "The term 'anti monsoon curve' refers to the occlusal curve of the teeth. It is a curve that is opposite to the natural curve of the teeth. The natural curve of the teeth is convex in the posterior region and concave in the anterior region. The anti monsoon curve is concave in the posterior region and convex in the anterior region. Based on this information, the anti monsoon curve is seen in the posterior teeth, specifically the premolars and molars. Therefore, the correct answer is D. All of the above.", "answer_choice": "D"}
